title.native: 私の百合はお仕事です！
title.romaji: Watashi no Yuri wa Oshigoto desu!

description:
Worried about her reputation, Hime covers shifts for a cafe manager she accidentally injures to maintain her picture-perfect princess image. But this cafe has a peculiar theme—private school. To put on her best barista schoolgirl act, she’ll be trained by the most graceful girl there, Mitsuki. Under her guidance, Hime’s feelings start to brew, but there’s just one problem—Mitsuki can’t stand her!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
hashtag: #わたゆりお給仕中 #わたゆり #私の百合はお仕事です
synonyms: ลิลี่ผลิบานเพราะเป็นงานหรอกนะคะ!

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Aromantic
tags.description: Features a character who experiences little to no romantic attraction.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

node.description:
[Official Website](http://n28.flop.jp/) | [Twitter]( https://twitter.com/n28miman) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/16438198)

She likes coffee, matcha, anko, chocolate and buttery popcorn with soy sauce flavor. Her passion is cooking. She likes to look into the distant sky and likes snow. She also likes to participate in the doujinshi convention “COMITIA”, where artists sell their self-published manga and artwork.

**Height:** 150 cm

[Website](http://www.ogurayui.jp) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/ogurayui-0815) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/OY_A_Official) | [Twitter (Personal)](https://twitter.com/yui_ogura_815) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjoIKN4CybsJyv0pWwAUJ5w) | [LINE](https://lineblog.me/ogurayui) | [Clare Voice](http://clare-voice.co.jp/talent) | [YuiKaori](http://www.yuikaori.info) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/27839.html) | [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E5%80%89%E5%94%AF) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yui_ogura_official) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@yui_ogura_offcial)

Not to be confused with [Yui Ogura (小倉結衣)](https://anilist.co/staff/123771).

Yui Ogura is an idol, actress, singer and voice actress (seiyuu) affiliated with Clare Voice. She is one of four members in Team Dekaris along with Kaori Ishihara, Arisa Noto, and Maho Matsunaga. She was one half of J-Pop duo [YuiKaori](https://anilist.co/staff/195974/), along with [Kaori Ishihara](https://anilist.co/staff/105217/) before the group disbanded in 2017. She is a former member of the seiyuu group [StylipS](https://anilist.co/staff/111177/), which was formed in 2011 and composed of the same members of Team Dekaris. Ogura's debut single "Raise" was released on July 18, 2012. She graduated from the group in April 2013.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Amatsukaze - Kancolle (VG)
- Taigei/Ryuuhou - Kancolle (VG)
- Harbour Princess - Kancolle (VG)
- Isolated Island Demon - Kancolle (VG)
- Avatar (Female) - Xenoblade Chronicles X (VG)
- Chris - Cross Ange: Tenshi to Ryū no Rondo tr. (VG)
- Excella - Summon Night 5 (VG)
- Kanako Fujii - Torikago no Marriage ~Hatsukoi no Tsubasa~ (VG)
- Lilia - Star Ocean 5 -Integrity and Faithlessness- (VG) 
- Lizerietta Marsh - Dungeon Travelers 2: The Royal Library & the Monster Seal (VG) 
- Luna - Shadowverse (VG) 
- Monologue Asahina - Girlfriend (Kari) (VG)
- March 7th - Honkai: Star Rail (VG) 
- Minori Hanasato - Project Sekai: Colorful Stage! feat. Hatsune Miku (VG) 
- Natasha - Memento Mori (VG) 
- Nina - Liberation of Azure (VG) 
- Noah - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG) 
- Passion Lip - Fate/Extra CCC (VG) 
- Passion Lip - Fate/Grand Order (VG)
- Primula - Shironeko Tennis (VG) (Japanese)
- Pupuru - Sei Madou Monogatari (VG) (Japanese)
- Rom / White Sister - Choujigen Game Neptune (VG) 
- Sharuru Cocott - Attou Teki Yuugi Mugen Souls (VG) 
- Shifty - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Urara Rurikawa - Omega Labyrinth Z (VG) 

__Non-anime staff credits:__
- Theme song performance for "Summon Night 6: Lost Borders" (VG) (Japanese)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uesaka_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/uesaka_sumire) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/uesakasumire) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/uesaka_sumire/) | [Record Label Profile](http://king-cr.jp/artist/uesakasumire/)

Sumire entered the entertainment industry at the age of 9, when she was scouted by Space Craft's junior talent division. In 2009, she landed her first regular radio gig as host of Web Raji@Dengeki Bunko, and in 2011, she transferred to animation division of Space Craft due her interest in becoming a voice actress. On March 12, 2016, Sumire received the Best Rookie Actress award in the 10th Seiyuu Awards. She has also been a member of the seiyuu unit ".lady." since 2014.

Sumire is fluent in Russian and loves the Soviet culture, which she became interested in after hearing the State Anthem of the USSR in her first year of high school. In April 2010, Sumire entered the Faculty of Foreign Studies at Sophia University, and she majored in the Russian language there.

Sumire is interested in history and war figurines, particularly Russian/Soviet history, the Showa era, and likes the book Romance of the Three Kingdoms. She also has had a strong interest in games, anime and manga ever since she was a child. Her other interests consists of photography, lolita fashion-- she works as a lolita model-- and drawing, which she is quite good at. She also loves rock and heavy metal; her favorite bands are Metallica, Judas Priest, Black Sabbath, Dragonforce, and Kinniku Shoujo Tai. Additionally, Sumire is very good friends with fellow seiyuu [Sachika Misawa](https://anilist.co/staff/102337/Sachika-Misawa), who has called Sumire "her waifu".

**Non-anime roles:**
- Rosalie - Memento Mori (VG)
- Exia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Drake - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/animeo0015) | [Website](http://yonisumu.fc2web.com/)

Worked as a composite artist in the beginning of his career.

**[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kat.njima)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kat_njima)**

**Katsuhiro Nakajima** is a Japanese sound effects creator/editor working for [Swara Production](https://anidb.net/creator/3214).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大橋恵)

_Note: Not to be confused with the painter Megumi Oohashi._
